author: Special Correspondent
text:
Jewellery shops which remained closed in Tiruchi on Wednesday as jewellers protested against 1 per cent duty on jewellery purchases.— PHOTO: A. MURALITHARAN

Jewellers in Tiruchi and other districts in the central region went on a three-day strike downing shutters to express their protest against the Union government’s announcement to re-impose 1 per cent excise duty on gold jewellery.

Several jewellery shops in the city’s main business centres — Big Bazaar street and Chinna Kadai Veedhi — remained closed for the day.

A former office-bearer of the Tiruchi Jewellers’ Association said the Union government’s announcement in the budget re-imposing 1 per cent excise duty on gold jewellery would impact the business of the jewellers.

Around 350 shops across Tiruchi district downed shutters heeding the strike call, he said.

Police sources said over 200 jewellery shops remained closed in Nagapattinam district.

The shops were closed in Nagapattinam, Mayiladuthurai and Sirkazhi. Around 40 shops in Ariyalur were closed.

Jewellery shops remained closed in Perambalur and Pudukottai districts.

Gold and diamond shops in the delta region downed shutters on Wednesday the first day of their three-day stir to protest the imposition of 1 per cent excise on gold jewellery made and purchased.

Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley had proposed the excise duty imposition in his Budget presented on Monday.

Kumbakonam Gold Merchants’ Welfare Association president T.R. Sekar and secretary S. Subbarayan said the excise duty imposition would grossly affect gold jewellery trade and would tax the buyers unnecessarily
title: Jewellers oppose 1 p.c. tax, down shutters
